str2: Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.
Once, once for all. Probably from hapas; one time.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From ana and phero; to take up.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Second; with the article: in the second place, for the second time. As the compare of duo; second.
Apart from, separately from; without. Adverb from chora; at a space, i.e. Separately or apart from.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To expect eagerly, wait for eagerly, look for. From apo and ekdechomai; to expect fully.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
